author: Brick_Cuppy
title: Bye Mom, I'm going to the moon!
review:
"Bye Mom, I'm going to the moon!"... Was the first thing I thought of when I saw the official images. Rocket Boy looked to be the best of the series 17 CMF's, so I had high expectations. Read on to see if he lives up to the high standard...

the Minifigure:

The rocket-costume is great, the rivets and red highlights are really nice touches to complete the cartoonish look. But that's nothing compared to what's underneath...... A torso printed with the Classic Space logo in Light Bluish Grey for the FIRST TIME!!! NCS(neo-classic space) lovers will go nuts over this, being in one of their main color choices for their MOC's. And finally, we have the accessory: a flag printed on both sides with a (slightly scribbly)Hand-drawn Classic Space logo, with some stars around it. The flag is probably my favorite part. I just love the way it's looks like someone actually drew it.

Searching Tips:

Feel for the rocket-costume (careful that it isn't corn cob guy's suit. His suit is knobbly, while rocket boy's is smooth), you'll know it buy the fins on the bottom and the ball at the top. You can confirm it by feeling for the flag or the pole.

Overall Opinion:

Rocket boy is an awesome minifigure. I would say he's the best of series 17! If you decide to get any one of the series 17 CMF's, I would recommend Rocket Boy!

author: Odeinoichus
title: Rocket TO THE MOON!
review:
Set #71018 Rocket Boy: More costumed characters from Series 17, this time this little boy is dressed up as a rocket ship.

The rocket ship costume has a lot of fun details, there's rivets running all the way around and some red markings on the fuselage. Underneath the costume this character has a grey outfit, a grey version of the classic LEGO Spaceman shirt with darker grey short legs. For accessories he comes with a printed homemade flag piece that shows the classic Space logo as drawn by the child.

Overall this is one of the strongest figures in the set and a must have for Classic Space fans. It's also great for MOC enthusiasts who want to use that torso for their Classic Space collection. Strongly recommended.

author: BuildTheBrick
title: Space, the final frontier.
review:
This minifig is perfect. The hat is perfect. It goes around his front and back. He looks like the young Jon-Luke Picard. Wanting to go to space!

 

All in all, he is a young astronaut like many adults wanted to be if they were young during the space race. good mold, print, and torso.

author: Lobo_da_boss_
title: One of the best suit figures
review:
Opening;

The rocket not is a fun figure , one of the best of his respective series and pleases the older classic space fan base .

The Minifigure-

His rocket piece is huge , dual moulded and printed it covers his entire body and has a window for his face , his head is very happy , his torso features an excellent classic space logo on light grey a new colour and his legs are the small legs in dark grey .

The accessories -

His accessory is a very adorable coloured in classic space logo on the flag piece with a 1×4 length bar as the handle . The stand is the standard black CMF stand .

In conclusion -

this is my favourite of this series of which I own 5/16 his is so cool and panders towards all ages so I recommend it to all .
